name: Pedro Rodríguez Suárez-Infiesta
title: Software Developer
teamwork: Software Developer with deep expertise in architecting, developing, and scaling high-traffic e-commerce websites and intense data-driven web applications using technologies based on React, Node and TypeScript. I am passionate about creating exceptional user experiences and fostering a culture of innovation, continuous improvement, and thorough documentation. Focused team player dedicated to owning, leading, and developing features from scratch while meeting deadlines and sprint goals. Enjoy collaborating closely with Product Managers and Designers to create rich features from discovery to delivery.

aboutMe.content: With a background in photography , video and graphic design, I started to gain interest in website technologies and web development around 2010 when I built my first photography blog using HTML and Markdown with Ghost to showcase my artwork and diaries. Then is started to gain knowledge in languages like HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP, and understanding more about how modern web applications work. In 2016, I started working with WordPress to manage content, develop and maintain e-commerce websites, and gradually improving my skills in web technologies. Later, I started to transform this curiosity to a passion to all things around the web, this passion led me to and to strengthen my Front-End skills, I attended the Upgrade Hub bootcamp during 2020, where I learned to build Single Page Applications and websites using Angular and React and developed APIs and backend systems with Node and Express. From that moment on, I decided to pursue a career as a Software Developer.

Most recently, I worked as a Software Developer at the Alexander von Humboldt Institute, where I architected micro-frontend solutions and browser extensions for privacy management, conducting A/B testing focusing on consent conversion rates and optimizing user experiences. Previously at Hashtag-You, I focused on optimizing e-commerce platforms, improving performance and implementing features that enhanced conversion rates for a websites with high traffic and sales around 50 million euros anually, guaranteeing 100% uptime and no reported issues or bugs even on the high traffic days like Black Friday. At Unea, I progressed from Junior to Mid-Level Developer, building full-stack applications with React, Next and GraphQL, developing complex components and business tailored features, practicing domain driven design, test driven development, and learning to work Agile with a team of great developers, mentors, product managers and designers that helped me to grow as a professional developer. My journey includes freelance web development and managing e-commerce platforms, where I initially discovered my passion for web development through WordPress and JavaScript.

experience.company: Law And Innovation Technology, Alexander Von Humboldt Institute For Internet And Society (HIIG)
description: Architected and implemented micro-frontend architecture for Consent Agent and Cookie banner components as standalone React components, facilitating reusable NPM packages.

Leveraged Chrome's chrome.storage API and Redux Sagas for seamless browser extension integration and a browser-first approach to consent management, ensuring data privacy, persistence, and efficient cross-origin data exchange.
Created a real-time event tracking API with NestJs and integrated it with Grafana to provide deep insights into user consent behaviour.
Collaborated & Translated complex legal data privacy requirements into user-friendly components.

Developed a data-driven A/B testing across 11 distinct combinations of Consent Agent and Cookie Banner variations, implemented feature maps for different test versions used by 1300 users over 14 days, increasing consent conversion by 10 to 15%.

Orchestrated a comprehensive website performance optimisation initiative, resulting in an estimated reduction of 10% in average page load time, improving user engagement metrics, time to first byte, CLS and standard conversion rates.
Implemented strategic JavaScript optimisation: code splitting with async and defer strategies to improve the loading of non-critical resources.

Led the modernisation of legacy JavaScript code related to custom coupon code implementations, replacing intricate callback-based asynchronous operations with the cleaner and more maintainable async/await syntax and Promises,enhanced error handling capabilities, and simplified the overall feature.

Conceptualised and implemented a "Quick Add to Cart" functionality enabling users to add products to their cart directly from a collection pages JSON without navigating to individual product detail pages. This functionality resulted in a noticeable increase of 5% in add-to-cart conversions that helped users reach the free shipping tiers faster.

Delivered interactive and highly engaging landing page campaigns for marketing initiatives and product launches, utilizing a cutting-edge combination of React, JavaScript, and Liquid (Shopify's templating language). One standout campaign centred around a custom riddles mini-app that increased user engagement by an estimated 10% during the peak Christmas season.

Engineered robust solutions that involved the integration and optimization of scripts for various Shopify apps. These critical improvements to ratings, reviews, and checkout extensions enhanced customer satisfaction at key steps. As a result, the website maintained 100% uptime, and there were no reported issues or bugs, allowing business operations to run smoothly even on high traffic days like Black Friday, and achieved as a solo developer.

Architected and developed with the Lead and CTO the adoption of CI/CD best practices using GitHub Actions and Vercel, automating testing and deployment for Next.js applications. This improved development efficiency and release frequency.

Progressed from Junior to Mid-Level Developer by building and documenting a significant part of the component library for the project. With great mentorship and support, I ended up owning complex features and demonstrating my skills developing full-stack Next.js applications with API routes, end-to-end type safety, middleware authentication with Apollo Server, and client-side data fetching with SWR (later replaced by ReactQuery).

Developed data cache-as-state (SWR) on top of the API requests, including the implementation of optimistic UI updates to provide a responsive and seamless user experience, particularly beneficial for the inline editing features in tables and scheduler components.

Implemented MSW (Mock Service Worker) for API mocking during testing, allowing robust and reliable testing of components in isolation and enabling replacement of SWR with ReactQuery with more confidence.

Led the development of complex components and application features, including interactive dashboards, tables with inline editing, sidebars, and scheduler components (leveraging Bryntum Gantt and Scheduler), while seamlessly integrating these with the application's cache-first, optimistic state management system.

Fostered close collaboration between backend developers, designers and PMs to align technical implementations with business requirements, ensuring rapid development cycles, frequent deployments, and optimal user experiences while maintaining code quality and adherence to design/architecture principles.

My first full time web developer experience. Developed the frontend of the Saenguin and Sensatia websites, e-commerce stores, using  Gatsby and React for Sensatia and Shopify Liquid, and CSS modules for Saenguin.
Developed and managed the company website and WooCommerce marketplace, including content, SEO optimization, stock management, and generating sales reports.
Discovered my passion about web development through this role, gaining experience with WordPress, WooCommerce, and JavaScript.
